Reviews.Title: “Not as described”
Reviews.Author: Rose G
Reviews.Content: The first few hours of this vacation were spent looking for alternative accommodation which we could not get unfortunately till the second night of our stay. We could not wait to check out. This hotel was not as they represented themselves. It did not have the advertised amenities and was dirty and possibly dangerous. The room was small and dingy with peeling paintwork and not particularly clean. The so called kitchenette had a toaster and a kettle but no plates, or cutlery or detergent or tea towel. Capable of tea and coffee making only and the cheapest brands available. There was no phone, iron, hairdryer or ironing board. There was exposed electrical wiring and an electrical switch with a hole where the switch was meant to be. There were holes in the wall, The arm chair had lost its padding and was dirty. We found it unusable. The TV reception was so poor that we could only select from about two of the channels. The bathroom was so dirty that I was glad we had some thongs to wear in the shower. There were no spare toilet rolls and no toilet cleaning brush. The so called double glazing only extended to one of windows so that it was so noisy we bought ear plugs and used the airconditioner to provide white noise. There is no lift so we lugged our bags up two double flights of stairs and there was no offer of help with this. The only redeeming feature was that the bed was relatively new and the linen was clean. We paid $130 for the room over the internet.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: FT87
Reviews.Content: For $100 a night this place is fine! Our room was clean and spacious, and we had tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was very small, badly painted and a bit musty smelling, but fine. Great location, short walk to everywhere decent in the city. Nice bars nearby too. For $100 a night in the city centre you can't complain. The week before we stayed here my boyfriend and I stayed in a backpackers for $65 a night where we had no private bathroom and we slept on bunkbeds in a room no bigger than my closet at home! Wattle is cheap, but fine! And the staff are friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “"Great hotel with excellent service"”
Reviews.Author: Jeffery77
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in Sydney Wattle Hotel, check in was very professional, the person who showed us to our room explained everything that was available in detail. Room was lovely as youâ€™d expect, bathroom pristine with bath and shower. We stayed at this hotel on Saturday night after being given the night by our daughter as our birthday presents. It was wonderful. Fantastic service and a great room very well equiped. We wish we could have stayed there longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Emily A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this boutique hotel couple of times on our recent visit to Sydney. We found this hotel to be in an excellent location. It's easy to walk to the major attractions from here (half an hour to the opera house by walk). The reception staff were friendly and accomodating. The room was warm when we arrived first time and had to spend a few minutes looking for the remote for the air con. We later found it on the wall behind the curtain. Except this, room was comfortable and airy. Overall, we found this an excellent choice of accommodation. I would recommend the place to anyone, and we'll certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT bad, but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Warris2500
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently. First off, its a great location, right on Oxford Street itself, so thats a plus there. Now, i had read some of these reviews before going and had it not been for their cancellation policy, i too would've cancelled. Anyway, it wasnt THAT bad. They have redone the entrance section and, i can only assume, laid new carpets on the stairs and the hallways. The foyer of our room stunk like smoke and in our room there were cigarette burns on the walls/furniture/bed. The beds themselves were hard, but sleepable. The double glazed windows made the sound of the street bareable and had aircon. The bathroom was a bit of a shamble. Toilet was cracked, the taps did not turn on/off, one handle even coming off. It was very old and needs replacing. The shower 'squeeled' when running. Now ALL of these would be forgivable had this been at a budget price, however, at $200/night, for 4 people, it really isnt that good a value. We could've stayed at a slightly more expensive place which would've been value for money. Plus there is no parking around that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun Location Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller52
Reviews.Content: Second time we stayed here and staff have been great to us! Geat little organic market with Best Coffee on wknds one block away This hotel is close to Oxford Art Factory for gigs, next to grog shop and pie face down the road for munch attacks. Walk out door to pubs, restaurants and awesome shopping. Short walk down to St Marys Cathedral, heritage buildings, statues, museum and parks make this a magnificent walk. Had so much fun both times Thanx Guys!

Reviews.Title: “Glimmer of Hope”
Reviews.Author: ThirteenThirtySeven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends over the past weekend. We decided we needed a place to stay after the night out and stumbled across the Wattle - relatively cheap and right in the heart of Oxford street. I've read all of the reviews here and yes, while there are some major issues with the place, it is in the middle of renovations. There was absolutely nothing wrong with the lobby - nice and clean with a simplistic modern design. The staircase leading to the rooms are another story, I too smelt the urine and cigarettes smell but I don't doubt this will be fixed during their renovations. Expecting a dump of a room I was actually very surprised when I first walked in. We stayed in room 105... nothing more than you would expect from a budget hotel, but (surprisingly) it was clean. No sign of cockroaches, clean sheets, walls and bathroom were clean etc. Not too keen on the theme they've gone for with the rooms though - golden curtains and golden framed mirrors but it's clear that they're aiming for a boutique budget hotel with some charm. I had no issues with the staff. I was served by a kind Asian lady - I really think some people must assume they're rude because they can't get past the language barrier. Sure sometimes she was difficult to understand, but she meant well. This hotel has a bright future after what apparently was a very dark past. Hopefully this positive review is the first of many to come after the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “'wattle' they do with this place?”
Reviews.Author: jucee
Reviews.Content: Room standard size for a modern hotel but modern hasn't applied to this place a for a long long time. On arrival I was met by friendly staff with mixed English capabilities. I paid my room bill on arrival but on offering my Amex card was told they had no EFTPOS and was asked to pay cash. I had just arrived and didn't have $178 in my wallet, They eventually found the old click swipe thing and took payment that way. After arrival in my room which was clean but with very old furniture and in desparate need of total refurbishment there was a knock the door. They couldn't take Amex and did I have another card? Gave then my Visa which was now ok. They did bring the previous Amex swipe and destroy it before me. $178 for the two nights plus $10 returnable deposit for the electronic room key Being a Queenslander and this the middle of winter I felt chill and asked for some heating and was told the a/c was reverse cycle. I turned it on with no joy and informed the staff who came and fiddled with it and said it would be fine in ten to fifteen minutes. It wasn't so they brought me a fan heater which was a bit noisy. I looked for the in-room tea and coffee, saw the kettle over the kitchen sized sink and eventually found tea gabs, coffee sachets and sugar sachets in a draw on the other side of the room but no milk which i didn't worry about as I don't' take it in tea and don't like instant coffee. However no cups to seen. Went back to reception to request cups which were promptly brought.....no in house phone. There were wall lights either side of the cheap bed but which was comfortable enough, just. Both lights flickered at a great rate and one or therm died shortly after being turned on. The bathroom is a mess with a corner sink where the tap runs constantly, not drips, runs ,and there was no plug to be seen. Toiletries consisted of two tubes of conditioning shampoo and one cake of guest soap. Fresh towels were provided on the first night for morning The hotel is in the thick of things right on Oxford street and not too noisy due to the thick secondary double glazing. Staff assured me that a massive renovation project was just about to begin.......................... No cafe/ breakfast room or bar. They are outside on oxford street Photos on hotel website totally misleading

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay here again,”
Reviews.Author: concerned1234
Reviews.Content: The room was absolutely disgusting, I found a crack pipe in the drawer and burn marks on the walls. The bed was missing a leg, and you could hear people engaging in sexual acts all through the night.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER, NEVER, NEVER STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: SasCanberra
Reviews.Content: I mean it! Take your chances on the street if no other accommodation is available. I travelled with my teenage daughter and we were completely disgusted. Filthy room, broken aircon and cupboard doors, last guest's glitter and pink fluff (!) all over the carpet. Disgusting bathroom complete with resident cockroaches - I made my daughter wear thongs in the shower! Cigarette burns over all the junk shop furniture and a pervading smell of smoke. Gross marks and smears all over the walls - I don't even want to think about what they might have been. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “misleading and deceptive”
Reviews.Author: holidayerQueensland
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusting. I would like to know how I can report this place as it needs to be shut down. All the other reviews are accurate. Words cannot describe how disgraceful this place is. The website is misleading and deceptive and the place is a total disgrace. I really am surprised they are allowed to operate and certainly how they can charge the money they do. We were charged $140 a night for two nights of our stay. We would have gone elsewhere but due to a busy weekend we were stuck here. The bathroom was actually mouldy. They provide no phone, iron, cupboard, hairdryer. The 'daily room service' doesn't include making the bed, but I get the feeling the cleaners know what sort of people usually stay here so i wouldn't make the bed either. We witnessed a sex act going on on the rooftop which was where our room was. The girl then knocked on our door, presumably thinking she had some more business... Then when we checked out and ask to speak to the manager we were told he wasn't working and a day later we are still waiting for a call back despite going back later in the day and making a phone call to speak to management. They also charged my credit card the afternoon we got there which can't be legal. Appalling. A Current Affair needs to pay this place a visit and have them shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Call in the health and building inspectors!”
Reviews.Author: Travelabit_10
Reviews.Content: Where do you start with this hole? Well, firstly they violated NSW consumer law by accepting payment for an advertised room that wasn't available and then downsized us with no offer of compensation. Complained to Gostay.com - no reply. Then on arrival, they sent us away twice because the room hadn't been cleaned. In fact, the only clean thing in there were the sheets. As for the advertised double glazed windows which are a must on drunken Oxford st - unfortunately not all the windows were D-G'd and the party in the laneway below raged into our room until 3am, punctuated by the frequent police sirens. Multiple fixtures broken, 50yo furniture, taps not working or fall off, cracked and loose tiles, tiny bathroom, mouldy, and stinking of smoke. Send in the OH&S inspectors, this place is shamefully poor value and not to Australian standards. The Wattle Hotel is poorly located and makes youth hostels look like the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disgrace!”
Reviews.Author: MatureTraveller48063
Reviews.Content: Hotel completely misrepresents its current condition. Pictures on Lastminute.com must have been taken years ago and there has been no maintenance since then! Mattress slashed, room dirty, curtains dirty, tv didnt work properly, shower dilapidated with tap handles falling off, wardrobe door fell of when tried to open it, mirror had fallen off wall, aircon barely worked, no towels (supplied when requested) only one coffee cup. However, water was hot with good pressure in shower. Had no choice but to stay when we arrived late in the day. You decide.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Avoid this hotel at all costs, DIRTY, SMELLY, AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Sydneykap
Reviews.Content: This old building/hotel is crying out for a refurbishment, some TLC and a real professional hotel team to run this establishment. We had an awful stay, hotel smells from people smoking in rooms, from people urinating in the stairwell, the only access to rooms! Rooms haven't been properly cleaned since maybe 1988 and are in need of repair and refurbishment. The pest man needs to be called as we were visited by many a cockroach. For the price one would expect the place to be atleast clean. Aircon did not work, we didn't even use the shower, thankfully only an overnight stay. The only thing ok about this hotel is the sheets were clean. Please, can someone help this old building and restore it to its former glory... it could be just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: SFpianist
Reviews.Content: Before our trip we had reserved the Vibe Hotel, and cancelled it when we found this so-called "find," based on a gay website's recommendation. After our endless flight to Sydney, imagine our horror and disappointment when we approached what appeared to be a fleabag dump of a place with street people hanging outside the front door. Our first impression of this dump was the smell of urine as we entered the hallway. It only went downhill from there. As soon as we took our bags up the four floors to our top floor "suite," we immediately decided we just couldn't stay there. All of the other reviews are completely accurate. I've never seen such a disgraceful display of bad management. Our rooftop room had great potential, because it's in a vibrant neighborhood, and within walking distance of most of what Sydney has to offer. The view from our private Harbour view deck is spectacular, but that's the ONLY redeeming factor of the place. The carpet smelled bad, the pillows and bedding were musty smelling, and there was a big hole in the bathroom door. Also, there was no closet to store our clothes, and we were afraid to even leave our bags in the room. If the owner would have taken care of this facility, it actually could have been a nice place. But, apparently the Chinese owner has no intention of upgrading the furniture (replete with cigarette butt stains, and a fridge that didn't work, and the rabbit ears on a TV set, which I haven't seen in decades, oh yes, I forgot the single lightbulb that hung from the ceiling with no shade around it... OMG, I wish I were kidding!). It was very close to a Welfare Hotel where drug addicts and hookers live. What a shame. The Wattle should not be in business anymore, and the pictures from their website are completely deceptive.... I wish we could get the word out, so nobody else makes the mistake we made. We tolerated one night, only because we didn't want to lose our deposit money, and we were tired as hell, but we immediately switched over to the Vibe Hotel the next morning, which is highly recommended, and only a few dollars more than the rat infested Wattle.... Avoid The Sydney Wattle at ALL costs.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a DOG!”
Reviews.Author: JeffMTulsa
Reviews.Content: We spent 15 days in OZ. I planned the trip through Frommers, which I have heretofore found to be reliable. I only wish I knew about TripAdvisor before I made my arrangements. To Frommer's credit, every other place/excursion I booked was as descibed or better, so I think this was a fluke - albeit a terrible one. If you want to get a laugh, read Frommers (Australia 2009) description of the dump. It sounds like they were describing it from the (totally misleading) website. We checked into the fleabag in the evening, so we were trapped for one night, but my wife's comment to me as we retired was "we are out of here tomorrow morning." She and I got up early and checked out a place she saw in a brochure - the Lido Suites on Rosylyn Street off Kings cross. THIS joint was great, it was just like the Wattle's website, in a much less seedy neighborhood, and was LESS expensive.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know how this place was recommended by Lonely Planet!”
Reviews.Author: TRoberts619
Reviews.Content: Be aware! The Wattle Hotel's Website is VERY deceiving. It may look cute on the outside. But the moment I walked into my shoe box-sized room, I knew I was in trouble. The walls were dirty and literally had writing on them from past room guests. The TV, Fridge, and some of the lights didn't work. And the A.C. was louder than World War II. Not to mention the roaches in the bathroom sink and the AWFUL service by the Asian, not fluent in English, staff. A local restaurant owner told me that the Wattle is usually used for prostitutes to take their men back to for some good time lovin'. That would explain the stains left on the comforter that was buried in the closet. Yea, THOSE stains. I do not wish this hotel on any of my enemies. It's THAT bad! After 2 sleepless nights, I finally transferred to the Marriott Hotel just up the road from the Wattle. 100000000 times better! I can finally get some sleep! What more can I say? Do not...I repeat...DO NOT stay at the Wattle Hotel on Oxford St.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Wattle digusting rip off”
Reviews.Author: Jeefo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a DISGUSTING RIP OFF and you shouldn't stay there in any circumstances. We booked to stay for four nights in this hotel based on their website and 4 star rating. On entering the hotel the front door was broken. The entrance hall and stairway were stinking. We had booked the king size room but apparently this had been double booked and we were given the family room. The room was appalling, their use of the word boutique is an attempt at an excuse for a downright filthy shambles. The bathroom consisted of a dirty dripping shower, broken tiles, broken clear window (onto street , no privacy) and mould. The so-called kitchen was part of the bathroom - an old worktop and sink. Coincidently, we met two young Aussies in the room next door who had many similar problems with their room. It wasn't just us. After a sleepless night due to the drunks shouting and being sick outside and poor quality beds, we packed our backs and went to reception first thing. We stated our complaints and that we were checking out. We generously agreed to pay for the one night we had stayed but wanted a refund for the next 3 nights. The receptionist and managment refused to give a refund. Eventually, using Mastercard complaints department we got 2 nights refunded. However desparate or short of money you are, DO NOT stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, discusting -BEWARE !!!”
Reviews.Author: bubbles20nz
Reviews.Content: we booked family room for 4 of us good size room for sydney infact heaps of room, bathroom scody, filthy not been cleaned dust around skirting boards, stains on carpet and on 2nd floor no lift, no teatowels or dishwashing liquid had to ask for coffee,tea etc, but we were lucky we saw no cockroaches this time in sydney,a must is ear plugs which we bought knowing it would be noisy on main street, web site does not portray true impression of this hotel not 4 * 's more like -4* is great area for people watching, and is gay central and weirdo central , really dissapointed as we went to see celine dion only to have her get sick and cancel on us... waste of a trip to aussie no photos as too dirty and horrid to waste on I felt that being very much a gay hotel for one night stands so to speak when I phoned to book a family room, after seeing it on the web site they could have said something to that effect, they were nice to us expecially the elder of the two, but we did feel we were in wrong hotel and wrong part of town,,, won't happen again

Reviews.Title: “Boutique for Cockroachs”
Reviews.Author: mcduffreturns
Reviews.Content: Avoid. Dirty and infested with cockroachs. it described itself as a boutique hotel online, but nothing could be further from the truth. Whatever the charge you for a room, it's overpriced, unless it's $60 or less.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: taspats
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty. The stairwell smelled of urine and cockroaches scampered about the room. The only good thing about this hotel was its location.

Reviews.Title: “Dont ruin your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: neverenoughtravel
Reviews.Content: On the website this â€œhotelâ€� looked nice and clean. But donâ€™t believe what you see. If you expect basic clean accommodation, look somewhere else. All we wanted to do after 18 hours in transit was to shower and have a nap â€“ instead we had to go find acceptable accommodation. I hope I can save someone else from this nightmare. We booked the room on the fourth floor. It was dirty and extremely neglected. If I wanted I could write my name in the dirt on the steps leading up to bathroom. Loads of hair on the sagging bed! A shelve in the bathroom provided for toiletries was covered in green mould. The curtains were hanging on for dear life. Thick dust everywhere. The carpet was extremely dirty- you would not dare to walk barefoot on that! A print that I suspect hang on the wall at some point was propped up on the couch. There is a reason why they charge a non refundable two night deposit. We just accepted that we would not get a refund and booked into Blue Woolloomooloo â€“ 5 stars all the way. We travel annualy for ten weeks and this is the fist time I have felt the compelling need to warn other travelers.

HotelInfo.Name: Wattle Private Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 108 Oxford Street | Darlinghurst, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
